TopicTitle: Who are you fav KSP youtubers?

Articles.Content: Scott Manley is by far my favorite. His tutorials were extremely helpful when I was starting out, and his reusable space program series keeps me coming back to his channel for more.
In my opinion Robbaz is my fave KSP player, but I don't watch much KSP.

OfficalNerdÃ‚Â³

I also REALLY agree with you, but he only has a few KSP videos.
i like scott manley and drjones( he dont have many vids tho) but he did go through actually building a station core and explaining whats needed and why....

[closed]

Edited July 4, 2021 by benjiful9000

Scott Manley, if you're in for some science.

kurtjmac, for casual gaming commentary.

Robbaz and Danny2462 if you want some laughs.

OfficalNerdÃ‚Â³

I think he meant REGULAR KSP youtuber, you monkey.

My favorite is Scott Manley for cool things, but Danny takes the cake for me.

jefmajor. He's the guy who got me to buy KSP.

And the point is that he's NOT good at it, but he tries really hard and learns. It's amazing to watch his development, then make a mistake. He's also genuinely funny. Not always for the kiddies, though.

Danny and ablu444, although the latter hasn't been active for 8 months.

Yeah, ablu444's the best in my mind, he doesn't upload much, but when he does it's the craziest stuff I've ever seen. (he flew to Minmus and the Mun in 1 trip using only SRB's, when they only came in 1 size) Makes Danny2462 look like a calm and controlled individual.

Scott Manley's next, a professional, expert pilot who understands and can explain the rocket science and history very well.

And Danny2462's stuff in fun.
Robbaz and Danny, both hillarious and entertaining to watch
I prefer Robbaz, I used to be a Manley fan but the he lost his luster after a while.
Scott Manley and kurtjmac (whos series introduced me to KSP - great for newcomers).

I think his voice is what makes him so fun to listen to. I'd love to have an Scottish accent.

It has nothing to do with his Scottish accent*, it's just his voice.

*Do Brits/Scots think East/Left coast U.S. folks have "accents"? I need to know...

I'm gonna have to say Scott Manley and Jef Major.

Scott's great if you want to learn how to play the game, but he's occasionally too sciencey for my liking. Whereas Jef's motto is "Victory Through Incompetence" and that sums up his KSP and Silent Hunter Lets Play's pretty well.

Edited June 30, 2013 by ScramblesTD

I usually watch Scott Manely and Danny, with some MattDennis and HOCGaming for their challenging youtubers series.

Scott's great if you want to learn how to play the game, but he's occasionally too sciencey for my liking. Whereas Jef's motto is "Victory Through Incompetence" and that sums up his KSP and Silent Hunter Lets Play's pretty well.

I, on the other hand, love the science!

Duncan seems to slowly be learning how to play, and his latest video is probably in the top five on my list of funniest KSP commentary videos XD. Honestly did not think he would learn how to play so fast.

[closed]

 

Edited July 4, 2021 by benjiful9000
Scott Manley, kurtjmac, Danny2462 And Robbaz
Very underrated youtuber is Chickenkeeper. He has some pretty good videos and he also live streams on twitch often.

Well currently for me I would have to say Scott Manley and TheWinterOwl.

Used to be TryDyingToLive as he got me into the game, I was really lucky to get onto his minecraft server and was in a couple of his videos, but I think he is dead. He hasn't uploaded in 6 months.

Edited June 30, 2013 by Orange7093

Pleborian and PurpleTargets.

Skip to 2 minutes and approximately 6 seconds to get to the good stuff.

Who says math isn't fun.

Edited July 1, 2013 by AustralianFries
Scott Manley for the science, HOCgaming for just KSP, and Macey for pure cinematics (with tutorials here and there)
Scott Manley, HOCgaming, Danny2462, and occasionally Kurtjmac.
Macey Dean. Awesome, dramatic story driven awesome.
Scott Manley, HOCgaming
